required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Poorly Designed School Furniture on Children's Head and Scapulae Postures
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Poorly Designed School Furniture on Children's Head and Scapulae Postures: A Cross Sectional Design

lead_sponsor.agency: Delta University for Science and Technology

clinical_study.source: Delta University for Science and Technology

brief_summary.textblock: investigate the compatibility of school furniture design

primary_outcome.description: It was calculated as the ratio of the subject's height (in meter) and weight (in kilogram) i.e. BMI= Weight/ Height2

The anthropometric measurement for child were measured in mm by Auto CAD analysis for recorded photographs from sitting position.it include:1) elbow seat height: Measured with the elbow flexed at 90°, as the vertical distance from the bottom of the tip of the elbow to the student's seated surface, 2) shoulder height: Measured as the vertical distance from the top of the shoulder at the acromion process to the student's sitting surface,3) upper limb length: Difference between the elbow height and shoulder height.

The furniture dimensions were measured in mm by Auto CAD analysis for recorded photographs from sitting position.it include: 1) seat height: Measured as a distance from the floor to the highest point on the front of the seat, 2) seat depth: Measured from the back of the sitting surface of the seat to its front,3) backrest height: The vertical distance from the desk seat to the top edge of backrest, 4)desk- seat height: The vertical distance from the seat to the top of the front edge of the desk and 5) under surface of desk height: The vertical distance from the floor to the bottom of the front edge of the shelf under the writing surface..

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between educational furniture dimensions and the user body dimensions
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year.
secondary_outcome.description: the percentage of compatibility for the ergonomics design of school furniture were tested by using the following equations: Equation (1): Seat height to popliteal height (N +2) cos 30°≤ SH < (N + 2) cos 5° Where SH is seat height and N is popliteal height). Equation (2): Seat depth to the popliteal-buttock length 80%M≤ SD < 95%M Where SD is seat depth and M is popliteal-buttock length. Equation (3): Backrest height:60% H≤ BH < 80% H Where BH is backrest height and H is shoulder height (scapula height). the previous equations represent the correlation between arthopemeteric measurements for the child (the user) and anthropometric measurement for school furniture.The percentage of matching and dis-matching school furniture calculated.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year.
secondary_outcome.description: Auto CAD program (version 2013) used to determine head postures (angles). 1) Head flexion angle: Line of canthus to tragus with respect to vertical (measured from vertical above intersect). 2) Neck flexion angle : Line of tragus to C7 with respect to vertical (measured from vertical above intersect)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year.
secondary_outcome.description: Auto CAD program (version 2013) used to determine scapular postures (displacement and elevation in mm). 1) Scapula displacement: Horizontal distance between markers at C7 and the anterior border of the acromion (measured in mm), 2)Scapula elevation: Vertical distance between markers at C7 and the anterior border of the acromion.

study_pop.textblock: Two hundred and fifty-seven normal children were evaluated for eligibility; thirty-five children were excluded because they failed to fulfill the inclusion criteria and sixteen parents refused to enrolled in this study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- had normal body mass index (ranged from 18.5 to 24.9 kg/ m2),
- The school furniture workstations used by all subjects were all of wooden flat desks and benches.
Exclusion Criteria:
- suffering from respiratory or heart problems

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Delta University for Science and Technology
responsible_party.investigator_title: Assistant. Professor of physical therapy, Department of Physical Therapy for Pediatrics
